issue.title: Library needs to ban macros named expects or ensures

discussion.p:
expects and ensures are not technically described as attribute-tokens when used in a contract-attribute-specifier, so the existing prohibition in doesn't apply to them.
The remaining special identifiers used by the contract attributes are all already covered by existing wording: assert is also a library name so falls under p1, default is a keyword, and both axiom and audit were added to Table 4.
discussion.note: 2018-07-20 Status to Tentatively Ready after five positive votes on the reflector.

resolution.p: This wording is relative to N4762.

blockquote.p: -2- A translation unit shall not #define or #undef names lexically identical to keywords, to the identifiers listed in Table 4, or to the attribute-tokens described in , or to the identifiers expects or ensures.
